intro: Ammannia herbacea, commonly known as prairie ammannia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist to wet soils in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. The plant features spreading, prostrate stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are borne in clusters and bloom from June to September. Ammannia herbacea is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
